mn120:3.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
mn120:3.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
mn120:3.7: “I shall teach you rebirth by choice. Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

mn120:18.7: They realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having achieved it with their own insight due to the end of defilements.
mn120:18.8: And, mendicants, that mendicant is not reborn anywhere.”
mn120:19.1: This is what the Buddha said.
mn120:19.2: Uplifted, the mendicants approved of what the Buddha said.
